name: Will
shortDescription: A Will or Testament is a legal declaration of the intention of a person when he wants to distribute his estate as a testator to the people who would be inheriting the estate after his death.
description: A Will or Testament is a legal declaration of the intention of a person when he wants to distribute his estate as a testator to the people who would be inheriting the estate after his death. A Will can be made by any person who attains majority at the age of 18 years, A Person must not be mentally challenged, but if a person who at the time of making the Will is mentally sound, that Will shall be valid in the eyes of Law.

variations.name: Will - Document draft - Customize
description: First Draft delivered within 3 working days

description: Document review and consult with the Lawyer
Redline version delivered within 8 working hours

howWeWork.heading: How to get a Will Agreement drafted

content.title: Schedule Call with the Lawyer
content.description: Schedule Call and discuss with the Lawyer your Document drafting requirements

content.title: Get your Agreement Draft
content.description: Lawyer will deliver customized draft of the Document as per your requirement

content.title: Dedicated Lawyer Available
content.description: 60 Minutes of Talk time with the Lawyer for discussing requirements and changes in the draft

content.title: First Draft within 3 Days
content.description: First draft of the Document will be delivered within a maximum of 3 working days

content.title: Finalise Document
content.description: 2/3 Iterations per Document allowed to incorporate your suggestions/changes

content.title: Information of the parties
content.description: The will states the name of the testator. It includes information like full name, birthdate, and address of the testator and legatee.

content.title: Assets and beneficiaries
content.description: The will outlines the assets to be bequeathed and who should get these assets. A beneficiary to a will could be any individual who is of sound mind and has attained the age of 18 years. The names of the beneficiaries along with the description of assets are written in the will.

content.title: Appointment of executor
content.description: An executor is a person nominated by the testator to execute the terms of the will. A family member or even a lawyer can serve as an executor. The details of the executor are mentioned in the will.

content.title: Testamentary intent
content.description: The executor shall declare that the document is a will and not some other document. It is to be used for the purpose of testamentary succession only.

content.title: Signatures
content.description: Signature is an important component of will. Law requires a will to be signed by the testator and two witnesses. The witnesses sign the document as confirmation of the testator’s identity and mental capacity.

content.title: Revocation of will
content.description: The testator has absolute powers to revoke his will at any time during his lifetime either expressly or impliedly.
A will ensures that the property of the testator is bequeathed according to the wish of the testator.
A will provides a legitimate distribution of property as it removes any customary laws involved in application of will.
A will helps in appointment of a guardian.

faqs.question: Is it necessary to register a will?
faqs.answer: In India, registration of Wills is not compulsory. A Will is not a compulsorily register able document under section 17 of the Registration Act, 1908.

faqs.question: Can I name a guardian for my children in my will?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can name a guardian for your children in your will. The guardian will have legal guardianship over the minor children until they reach the age of 18.

faqs.question: How do I revise my will?
faqs.answer: You revise your will by making a new will or by adding a codicil. A codicil is a document that amends an existing will, but does not replace it. It allows you to change your will without making an entirely new will.

faqs.question: I have a will; how can I get it reviewed by a Lawyer?
faqs.answer: ezyLegal can help you get your will reviewed and provide you with the right legal guidance. You can upload your document and schedule your Consultation with an ezyLegal Lawyer.

faqs.question: What is the process of getting the Agreement drafted from ezyLegal?
faqs.answer: ezyLegal offers Standard and Customized Document drafts. If you chose the Customized Document option, your call will be scheduled with a Lawyer to whom you can explain your specific requirements. The first draft will be delivered within 2 working days and then you would be allowed 2-3 iterations to make changes in the draft.

faqs.question: How will the Document be delivered to me?
faqs.answer:
The Document when ready will be available on the ezyLegal website (www.ezylegal.in) in your secured Account. You will be notified on email and WhatsApp whenever a new version of the Document is uploaded. You can Log-in and View or Download the document. 
Copy of the documents delivered by ezyLegal will always be available in your ezyLegal account forever.
